alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:15PM EST until January 10 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Delaware, including the following counties, Kent and New Castle and northeast Maryland, including the following counties, Caroline, Kent, Queen Anne`s and Talbot. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 814 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Higher tides near the coast will exacerbate flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Dover, Middletown, Easton, Centerville, Talbot, Smyrna, Milford, Chestertown, Denton, Centreville, Harrington and Romancoke. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
